results.title: Sir Robert Helpmann
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Sir Robert Helpmann trained with the legendary ballerina Anna Pavlova and had a successful career in musical comedy in Australia before travelling to England where he became a star of both the “Sadler’s Wells Ballet” and the “Old Vic.”. Helpmann remembers his association with Ninette de Valois and his first meeting with Margot Fonteyn, the beginning of a twenty-seven year partnership. Helpmann combined his successful international career in ballet, theatre and film with his commitment to the development of the “Australian Ballet”. He discusses the background to his ballet, “The Display” and his collaboration with Rudolf Nureyev on the film of “Don Quixote”. As a dancer, choreographer, actor and director Sir Robert Helpmann has made a unique contribution to the performing arts in Australia.

results.title: Sir Oliver Joseph Lodge: mathematical physicist
results.brief_description: An historic film of Sir Oliver Lodge, mathematical physicist and winner of the 1932 Faraday Medal. Sir Oliver, in his 84th year, reviews the electrical age, recalling the early days of discovery including the first dynamo, and incandescent lamp, Alexander Graham Bell demonstrating the telephone, and the work of Hertz.

results.title: Sir Joseph Thomson
results.brief_description: Born in 1856, Joseph Thomson devoted his life to the study of physical science and acheived distinction as an experimentalist and as a teacher. In this film he presents a paper on the importance of scientific discoveries and their application in commerse and industry, resulting in employment and technological advances.

results.title: Sir Johnny-on-the-spot
results.brief_description: A marionette show set on the mythical Isle of Dragonia. Princess Moonglow has to choose a dragon to ride in the grand parade. Star is a beautiful but lazy and conceited dragon and his brother Spot is modest and punctual, but quite ordinary in appearance. She must select the first one she sees at sunrise. Encourages ideas about promptness, reliability and modesty. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Sir John Monash
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Jennie Blackwood, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, State Electricity Commission of Victoria and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Reviews the life and work of the Australian scholar, lawyer, soldier and engineer, Sir John Monash. Shows his career as an engineer; a commander of troops in World War I; and his work as a Commissioner of the State Electricity Commission during the development of Yallourn. Edited by Jennie Blackwood; photographed by Adrian Bodington; sound by Alan Allen; introduction by John West.

results.title: Sir John Everett Millais
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Gordon, BBC and Anita Sterner
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Millais’ birth. This program retraces his life and work through letters to and from his contemporaries and through a large collection of paintings and drawings. Provides a complement to “The Pre-Raphaelite revolt”. Narrated by Anne Massey.

results.title: Sir John Cockroft
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and British Information Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
Sir John Cockcroft, Director of Britain’s Atomic Research Establishment, answers question, put to him by Robert McKenzie, about construction and operation of the Calder Hall nuclear power station and the establishment of the Canadian Atomic Research Center at Chalk River. He talks about the far-reaching effects of Britain’s atomic power program on the everyday life of Britain and the Commonwealth whilst also making it clear that nuclear power is always more expensive - up to 10 times more - than fossil fuels. Closes with live footage of the Queen’s opening speech at Calder Hall.

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Sir Francis Drake
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatises the preparation and execution of Sir Francis Drake’s raids on the Pacific coast empire of Spain in America. Illuminates the conflicting parties at Elizabeth I’s court - those wishing to conciliate the mighty Philip II, of Spain, and those who sought to attack his vast empire, seize gold and gain glory. Shows how Drake’s extended raid in the Pacific led to the circumnavigation of the world by his ship, the Golden Hind.

results.title: Sir David Attenborough
results.creator_credit: John Walsh, Kevin Ryder and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Sir David Attenborough talks with three Australian journalists about his life’s work, what influences him, how he feels about his work, his thoughts on society and the environment, and his optimistic view of the future.
